body: Any reason to have the default constructor and specify default values for the default args? Note that the compiler forces initialization when a member is `const`, so moving the initialization of the defaults to bitcoind.cpp seems cleaner.

Updated f0add1453739be415962c1a4223c7244db4171e5 -> 6a5f5d8b3fc2dcad1b64a59fe9beacde739b578b ([pr19471.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.01) -> [pr19471.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.02), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr19471.01..pr19471.02)):

- addressed @MarcoFalke's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19471#discussion_r451639906):
> Any reason to have the default constructor and specify default values for the default args? Note that the compiler forces initialization when a member is `const`, so moving the initialization of the defaults to bitcoind.cpp seems cleaner.
[Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19471#issuecomment-655603970).

Rebased 96192efd58df41ae871bed2c9d3032bb221f8630 -> c501b996a71db82fce778375fec5482e80e506bf ([pr19471.06](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.06) -> [pr19471.07](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.07)) due to the conflict with #19098.
@ryanofsky Mind reviewing this PR?

In commit "util: Add DefaultArgHints struct" (f5e3b93076403997ce9a3e23253fdaa5514753c9)

- I think this struct should be moved to `init.h` and not be in system.h, since it's defining options for `SetupServerArgs` and `AppInit` function, not interacting with the `ArgsManager` class or other system functions. It's fine to include `init.h` in gui code and https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/35 makes the call to `SetupServerArgs` there more direct
- To be a little more consistent with naming and explicit, would rename `DefaultArgHints` to `ServerArgsOptions`, and rename `printtoconsole` to `printtoconsole_default`, and rename `server` to `server_default`. I think `ServerArgsOptions::gui` is a better name than `DefaultArgHints::gui` because the `gui` value is used to show or hide help text, not to determine default argument values.

Updated c501b996a71db82fce778375fec5482e80e506bf -> 0ae8c14d8d85eda41ecb1731b9788a58e332df09 ([pr19471.07](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.07) -> [pr19471.08](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.08), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr19471.07..pr19471.08)):

- addressed @ryanofsky's [comments](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19471#discussion_r469241973)

@ryanofsky 
Thank you for your review! [Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19471#issuecomment-673554481).

Rebased 1a02a037a53a10995892c4bd86faa663cad8f656 -> d796dd09dd0866f391cf5663bc8e1cc8ca1b3402 ([pr19471.11](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.11) -> [pr19471.12](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.12)) due to the conflict with #21007.

Rebased d796dd09dd0866f391cf5663bc8e1cc8ca1b3402 -> 2ce271c84d7ac5cee0cb79f5f04662b8b7c42f5b ([pr19471.12](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.12) -> [pr19471.13](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.13)) on top of the #21447.

what is the point of overwriting the arg here, but keeping the default value as `!args.GetBoolArg("-daemon", false)` where it is parsed? It would be cleaner to not do any overwriting here and simply use printtoconsole_default as default value.

Besides https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/2ce271c84d7ac5cee0cb79f5f04662b8b7c42f5b/src/init.cpp#L894 we also have https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/2ce271c84d7ac5cee0cb79f5f04662b8b7c42f5b/src/bitcoin-wallet.cpp#L67 with a different default value.
bitcoin-wallet is a completely separate binary that isn't even modified in this PR. I fail to see how this is relevant to the discussion?

Updated 2ce271c84d7ac5cee0cb79f5f04662b8b7c42f5b -> e7198353c72e7f6dcfacb4bf1cc4a284afcee0a8 ([pr19471.13](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.13) -> [pr19471.14](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.14), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr19471.13..pr19471.14)):

- drop unneeded forward declaration
Why add a data member to ArgsManager? Just pass it into `InitLogging` by reference?

> Just pass it into `InitLogging` by reference?

What about `interfaces::Node::initLogging()`?

> what is the point of overwriting the arg here, but keeping the default value as `!args.GetBoolArg("-daemon", false)` where it is parsed? It would be cleaner to not do any overwriting here and simply use printtoconsole_default as default value.

It will change the current behavior, as for `bitcoind` the `printtoconsole_default` must be disabled when the `-daemon` option is set.

Updated e7198353c72e7f6dcfacb4bf1cc4a284afcee0a8 -> ccc0388e18e1340387baa0bcdb8a812e48793721 ([pr19471.14](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.14) -> [pr19471.15](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr19471.15), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr19471.14..pr19471.15)):

- addressed @MarcoFalke's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19471#discussion_r606195262)

@MarcoFalke 

Thanks! [Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/19471#issuecomment-822027233).
